intro: Helia nemorosa, commonly known as the forest heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas, preferring moist, shaded environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Helia nemorosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
